com.yahoo.search.federation.http

Class HTTPProviderSearcher

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.yahoo.component.AbstractComponent
      • com.yahoo.component.chain.ChainedComponent
        • com.yahoo.processing.Processor
          • com.yahoo.search.Searcher
            • com.yahoo.search.cluster.PingableSearcher
              • com.yahoo.search.cluster.ClusterSearcher<Connection>
                • com.yahoo.search.federation.http.HTTPSearcher
                  • com.yahoo.search.federation.http.HTTPProviderSearcher
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Component, NodeManager<Connection>, Comparable<Component>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ConfiguredHTTPProviderSearcher

    public abstract class HTTPProviderSearcher
extends HTTPSearcher
    Superclass of searchers which talks to HTTP backends. Implement a subclass to talk to a backend over HTTP which is not supported by the platform out of the box.

    Implementations must override one of the unmarshal methods to unmarshal the response.

    Author:
    Arne Bergene Fossaa, bratseth

        Parameters:

        connections - the connections this will load balance and fail over between
        parameters - the parameters to use when making http calls

    • Method Detail

      • configureCache

        @Deprecated
protected void configureCache(com.yahoo.search.cache.QrBinaryCacheConfig cacheConfig,

      • unmarshal

        public void unmarshal(InputStream stream,
                      long contentLength,
                      Result result)
               throws IOException
        Unmarshal the stream by converting it to hits and adding the hits to the given result. A convenience hook called by the default unmarshal(entity,result). Override this in subclasses which does not override unmarshal(entity,result).

        This default implementation throws an exception.

        Parameters:
        stream - the stream of data returned
        contentLength - the length of the content in bytes if known, or a negative number if unknown
        result - the result to which unmarshalled data should be added
        Throws:
        IOException

      • unmarshal

        public void unmarshal(org.apache.http.HttpEntity entity,
                      Result result)
               throws IOException
        Unmarshal the result from an http entity. This default implementation calls unmarshal(entity.getContent(), entity.getContentLength(), result) (and does some detailed query tracing).
        Parameters:
        entity - the entity containing the data to unmarshal
        result - the result to which unmarshalled data should be added
        Throws:
        IOException

      • addNonExcludedSourceProperties

        protected void addNonExcludedSourceProperties(Query query,
                                              Map<String,String> queryMap)

      • inspectAndReturnFinalResult

        protected Result inspectAndReturnFinalResult(Result result,
                                             Hit requestMeta,
                                             Exception e)
        Hook called at the moment the result is returned from this searcher. This default implementation does return result.
        Parameters:
        result - the result which is to be returned
        requestMeta - the request information hit, or null if none was created (e.g if this was a cache lookup)
        e - the exception caused during execution of this query, or null if none
        Returns:
        the result which is returned upwards

      • search

        public Result search(Query query,
                     Execution execution,
                     Connection connection)
        Description copied from class: ClusterSearcher
        Perform the search against the given connection. Return a result containing an error or throw an exception on failures.
        Specified by:

      • getQueryMap

        public Map<String,String> getQueryMap(Query query)
        Returns the key-value pairs that should be added as properties to the request url sent to the service. Must be overridden in subclasses to add the key-values expected by the service in question, unless HTTPSearcher.getURI(com.yahoo.search.Query, com.yahoo.search.federation.http.Connection) (from which this is called) is overridden.

        This default implementation returns the query.properties() prefixed by "source.[sourceName]" or "property.[propertyName]" (by calling addNonExcludedSourceProperties(com.yahoo.search.Query, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.String>)).

        Overrides:
        getQueryMap in class HTTPSearcher

      • getCacheKey

        @Deprecated
public abstract Map<String,String> getCacheKey(Query q)
        Deprecated. the cache key is ignored as there is no built-in caching support
